intro: Euphrasia kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that resemble eyes, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Euphrasia kurdica is often found in high-altitude environments and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
